text:
Georgia Bright Engel (July 28, 1948 – April 12, 2019) was an American actress. She was the voice of Bobbie in the "Open Season" franchise. She was also on "The Mary Tyler Moore Show" and on "Everybody Loves Raymond". She had two Emmy nominations for both shows. She was born in Washington, D.C..
She played a good witch in the 2007 recurring role of Esmeralda on the NBC soap opera "Passions".
Engel died of unknown causes in Princeton, New Jersey on April 12, 2019 at the age of 70.
